item.description: [#15] Just thought you should know

item.title: Hitler
item.description: [#29] So he's saying that God thought Hitler's art was so bad that the Holocaust was an acceptable alternative. It's no secret that the hat guy is closely based on Aram, from Men in Hats.

item.title: Donner
item.description: [#30] Some people haven't heard of the Donner Party. They were pioneers who got stranded and likely resorted to cannibalism.

item.title: Super Bowl
item.description: [#60] The Super Bowl is actually an elaborate ruse, concocted by a shadowy group in the mid sixties for this purpose. The 'watch it for the ads' addition was a master stroke.

item.title: Stacey's Dad
item.description: [#61] I bet she gets you to mow the lawn, doesn't she?

item.description: [#62] Love and circuit analysis, hand in hand at last.

item.description: [#63] Just pretend you're kidding.

item.title: Solar Plexus
item.description: [#64] It hurts to be hit there, you know

item.title: Banter
item.description: [#65] This was an actual mock conversation between me and a friend at TGiF. The waitress walked up around panel 5 and was somewhat put off.

item.description: [#66] Medium: Pencil on paper

item.description: [#67] Nothing personal, high schoolers.

item.description: [#68] The 8th panel is my favorite

item.description: [#69] Maybe I should've tried Wexler?

item.description: [#70] And then do it again in a moment now that they're out of Star Power

item.description: [#71] It was tricky.

item.description: [#72] A term coined by my friend Beth

item.description: [#73] A tribute to Buttercup Festival

item.description: [#74] This one is from the Red Belt collection, of 'medium' difficulty.

item.description: [#75] I find so much fun in language.

item.title: Familiar
item.description: [#76] :(

item.title: Bored with the Internet
item.description: [#77] I used to do this all the time.

item.title: Garfield

item.title: Iambic Pentameter
item.description: [#79] Of course, you don't wanna limit yourself to the strict forms of the meter. That could get pretty difficult.

item.title: My Other Car
item.description: [#80] It's much better than the other one.

item.title: Attention, shopper
item.description: [#81] There's a red convertible outside my building with the license plate 'DADS MNY'.

item.title: Frame
item.description: [#82] ...

item.title: Katamari
item.description: [#83] As the King of All Cosmos remarked, 'Is it that it's fun, or that it lets you forget yourself?'

item.title: National Language
item.description: [#84] She's pretty sharp when provoked.

item.title: Paths
item.description: [#85] It's true, I think about this all the time.

item.title: Digital Rights Management
item.description: [#86] If you're interested in the subject, Lawrence Lessig's 'Free Culture' is pretty good

item.title: Velociraptors
item.description: [#87] You're probably thinking, 'has it been a decade?' It's been over thirteen years, buddy.

item.title: Escher Bracelet
item.description: [#88] The only downside is that it would be a little uncomfortable

item.title: Gravitational Mass
item.description: [#89] She's so fat the attraction goes up as the CUBE of the distance instead of the square

item.title: Jacket
item.description: [#90] We have this conversation at least once a day in my apartment

item.title: Pwned
item.description: [#91] I'm sure a discussion of the reason for the disappearance of adventure games in favor of RPGs would be fascinating

item.title: Sunrise
item.description: [#92] Sometimes, I sit on top of parking decks and watch the sun rise. I feel like I should have a guitar or something.

item.title: Jeremy Irons
item.description: [#93] Movies that I know word-for-word, part one

item.title: Profile Creation Flowchart
item.description: [#94] This one goes out to xxCrazyPixie1987xx

item.title: The Sierpinski Penis Game
item.description: [#95] Inappropriate places for the Penis Game include baby showers and terrorist attacks

item.title: Mail
item.description: [#96] I'm on the USPS No Fly List

item.title: A Simple Plan
item.description: [#97] This is true. The lyrics are ridiculous.

item.title: Fall Apart
item.description: [#98] #pugglewumper Tashari got me some ink pens! I've been experimenting with them.

item.title: Binary Heart
item.description: [#99] i love you

item.title: Family Circus
item.description: [#100] This was my friend David's idea

item.title: Laser Scope
item.description: [#101] I wish I'd missed you then so I wouldn't be missing you now

item.title: Back to the Future
item.description: [#102] He's kind of an asshole, when you think about it

item.title: Moral Relativity
item.description: [#103] It's science!

item.title: Find You
item.description: [#104] I'm like the Terminator, except with love!

item.title: Parallel Universe
item.description: [#105] It's possible. Better to be on the safe side.

item.title: Wright Brothers
item.description: [#106] I'm not sure if this is actually true

item.title: Snakes on a Plane! 2
item.description: [#107] James suggested this, and I have to agree. It'd be much worse.

item.title: M.C. Hammer Slide
item.description: [#108] Once, long ago, I saw this girl go by. I didn't stop and talk to her, and I've regretted it ever since.

item.title: Spoiler Alert
item.description: [#109] And then it turns out they're both Tyler Durden.

item.title: Clark Gable
item.description: [#110] Frankly, my dear, I don't give a BITCH ASS SHIT FUCK DAMN

item.title: Firefox and Witchcraft - The Connection?
item.description: [#111] ThisadpaidforbythecounciltopromoteMicrosoftandChristianity. Remember, The Bible is Closed Source.

item.title: Baring My Heart
item.description: [#112] I'm just trying to explain, please don't be jealous! Man, why are all my relationships ruined by early 90's rappers?

item.title: Riemann-Zeta
item.description: [#113] The graph is of the magnitude of the function with the real value between 0 and 2 and the imaginary between about 35 and 40. I've misplaced the exact parameters I used.

item.title: Computational Linguists
item.description: [#114] Chomskyists, generative linguists, and Ryan North, your days are numbered.

item.title: Meerkat
item.description: [#115] Gorilla, yes. Adorable golden retriever, yes. But it says nothing about meerkats.

item.title: City
item.description: [#116] God, she's such a whore.

item.title: Pong
item.description: [#117] Following this, the pong paddle went on a mission to destroy Atari headquarters and, due to a mixup, found himself inside the game The Matrix Reloaded. Boy, was THAT ever hard to explain to him.

item.title: 50 Ways
item.description: [#118] I woke up to find that I had scrawled the last line of this sleepily on a sheet of paper on my desk. I shouldn't have listened to the 70's hit marathon on the way home from work the night before.

item.title: Worst Band Name Ever
item.description: [#119] You can just see his dejection as he realizes he's the lead guitar in 'Hedgeclipper'

item.title: Dating Service
item.description: [#120] I don't understand why people are so disingenuous! I just want someone to walk with!

item.title: Balloon
item.description: [#121] So I'm a bad person.

item.title: Quirky Girls
item.description: [#122] Romantic comedy heroines, I'm talking to you.

item.title: Centrifugal Force
item.description: [#123] You spin me right round, baby, right round, in a manner depriving me of an inertial reference frame. Baby.

item.title: Blogofractal
item.description: [#124] Edward Tufte's 'The Visual Display of Quantitative Information' is a fantastic book, and should be required reading for anyone in either the sciences or graphic design.

item.title: Marketing Interview
item.description: [#125] There are a lot of books on marketing out there. I wonder if you're safest just buying the most popular one.

item.title: Red Spiders Cometh
item.description: [#126] Uh-oh.

item.title: The Fast and the Furious
item.description: [#127] Sometimes when I steer shopping carts around corners, I slide them a little and pretend I'm getting the blue spark boost.

item.title: dPain over dt
item.description: [#128] You laugh to keep from crying, you do math to keep from crying . . .

item.title: Content Protection
item.description: [#129] If you think the purveyors of DRM simply want to protect artists, check out chapters 13 and 14 in Free Culture, by Lawrence Lessig. Their goal is the elimination of all culture they don't control.

item.title: Julia Stiles
item.description: [#130] I found an old tape of this episode in my family's closet. Check the news section of the forums to see the clip!

item.title: Fans
item.description: [#131] It's not going to break the fan, bouncing a rubber ball off the wall isn't going to dent it, and the roof can hold me just fine. You LIED!

item.title: Music Knowledge
item.description: [#132] When Guitar Hero 2 comes out I'll have fresh conversational material for MONTHS.

item.title: The Raven
item.description: [#133] Yes, Eminem is wearing a sleeveless hoodie. What of it?

item.title: Myspace
item.description: [#134] It's like they got together and said 'what do we miss most from the internet in 1998? that's right, embedded MIDI!'

item.title: Substitute
item.description: [#135] YOU THINK THIS IS FUNNY?

item.title: Science Fair
item.description: [#136] This project actually inspired a two-hour powerpoint presentation that Al Gore gave around the country.

item.title: Dreams
item.description: [#137] In Connor's second thesis it is stated 'There is no fate but what we make for ourselves.' Does the routine destroy our creativity or do we lose creativity and fall into the routine? Anyway, who's up for a road trip!

item.title: Pointers
item.description: [#138] Every computer, at the unreachable memory address 0x-1, stores a secret. I found it, and it is that all humans ar-- SEGMENTATION FAULT.

item.title: I Have Owned Two Electric Skateboards
item.description: [#139] Both the skateboards I owned were pretty cheap and broke from heavy use; I'm gonna get a really nice one if I move to the city.

item.title: Delicious
item.description: [#140] I'm currently in the I Have Cheese phase of this cycle.

item.title: Parody Week: Achewood
item.description: [#141] I always wanted to impress them with how well I could hear, didn't you? Also, this sets the record for number of awkward-pause panels in one strip (previously held by Achewood)

item.title: Parody Week: Megatokyo
item.description: [#142] I just want to give him a hug or something.

item.title: Parody Week: TFD and Natalie Dee
item.description: [#143] Although bees with tires would be kinda funny.

item.title: Parody Week: A Softer World
item.description: [#144] The robot is pregnant. It isn't mine.

item.title: Parody Week: Dinosaur Comics
item.description: [#145] Guys: while I was writing this, I accidentally swallowed a table-sized slab of drywall. I know! Wacky.

item.title: Join Myspace
item.description: [#146] I really shouldn't abuse that power so heavily.

item.title: A Way So Familiar
item.description: [#147] Two Hedwig references, an obscure Joey Comeau reference, and a girl with a mohawk. Yes.

item.title: Mispronouncing
item.description: [#148] My pal Emad does this all the time. 'Hey man, which way to the airpart?'

item.title: Sandwich
item.description: [#149] Proper User Policy apparently means Simon Says.

item.title: Grownups
item.description: [#150] I've looked into this, and I can't figure out a way to do it cheaply. And I guess it wouldn't be sanitary.

item.title: Mario
item.description: [#151] Why would anyone ever, ever say that? Please, nobody ever say that.

item.title: Hamster Ball
item.description: [#152] Reportedly, double-walled inflatable balls like this exist somewhere. Now to find that place.

item.title: Cryptography
item.description: [#153] If you got a big keyspace, let me search it.

item.title: Beliefs
item.description: [#154] Scientists are also sexy, let's not forget that.

item.title: Search History
item.description: [#155] SomethingAwful has a wonderful compilation of crazy AOL searches in their Weekend Web archives, 2006-08-13.

item.title: Commented
item.description: [#156] Your IDE's color may vary.

item.title: Filler Art
item.description: [#157] Maybe I should let up on Megatokyo a little?

item.title: Six Months
item.description: [#158] But then she does that thing with her tongue and I remember why I left you.

item.title: Boombox
item.description: [#159] And she's gonna feel like a jerk when she realizes it was actually Under Pressure.

item.title: Penny Arcade Parody
item.description: [#160] No one show this to Tycho's wife, okay?

item.title: Accident
item.description: [#161] As far as treachery-as-driving-music goes, Katamari music is matched only by Guitar Hero music.

item.title: Angular Momentum
item.description: [#162] With reasonable assumptions about latitude and body shape, how much time might she gain them? Note: whatever the answer, sunrise always comes too soon. (Also, is it worth it if she throws up?)

item.title: Donald Knuth
item.description: [#163] His books were kinda intimidating; rappelling down through his skylight seemed like the best option.

item.title: Playing Devil's Advocate to Win
item.description: [#164] There are so many well-meaning conservatives around here who just assume global warming is only presented as a moral issue for political reasons.

item.title: Turn Signals
item.description: [#165] I'm not very good at meeting people.

item.title: Misusing Slang
item.description: [#166] It slowly dawns on us that our parents knew exactly what they were doing.

item.title: Nihilism
item.description: [#167] Why can't you have normal existential angst like all the other boys?

item.title: Reverse Euphemisms
item.description: [#168] I'm still waiting for a chance to use 'I have to see a man about a horse'.

item.title: Words that End in GRY
item.description: [#169] The fifth panel also applies to postmodernists.

item.title: Turn Back
item.description: [#170] I hear that these days Bill Watterson is happy just painting in the Ohio woods with his father and doesn't get any mail or talk to anyone.

item.title: String Theory
item.description: [#171] This works on pretty much every level.

item.title: Skateboarding is Not a Crime
item.description: [#172] 'Arrest me, I'm a skateboarder' is an even more obnoxious variant.

item.title: Movie Seating
item.description: [#173] It's like the traveling salesman problem, but the endpoints are different and you can't ask your friends for help because they're sitting three seats down.

item.title: That's What SHE Said
item.description: [#174] Yes, I mean she said that during sex. Yes, it was a little weird.

item.title: Automatic Doors
item.description: [#175] I hope no automatic doors I know read this. I would be so embarrassed.

item.title: Before Sunrise
item.description: [#176] It's an amazing time of day; the light is great for photography.

item.title: Alice and Bob
item.description: [#177] Yet one more reason I'm barred from speaking at crypto conferences.

item.title: Not Really Into Pokemon
item.description: [#178] As of this writing, Ubuntu 6.10 and Firefox 2.0 have left my computer a complete mess.

item.title: e to the pi times i
item.description: [#179] I have never been totally satisfied by the explanations for why e to the ix gives a sinusoidal wave.

item.title: Canada
item.description: [#180] IT'S ALL REAL

item.title: Interblag
item.description: [#181] Sometimes I hate the internet. Sometimes it makes me happy that 'The Tubes' has become slang for the internet so quickly.

item.title: Nash
item.description: [#182] Maybe someday science will get over its giant collective crush on Richard Feynman. But I doubt it!

item.title: Snacktime Rules
item.description: [#183] I am not making this rule up. Although my mom wants you all to know it made perfect sense at the time.

item.title: Matrix Transform
item.description: [#184] In fact, draw all your rotational matrices sideways. Your professors will love it! And then they'll go home and shrink.

item.title: Wikifriends
item.description: [#185] It's crazy how much my gut opinion of a movie/song is swayed by what other people say, regardless of how I felt coming out of the theater.

item.title: Console Lines
item.description: [#186] If I get a Wii, it will be the first game console I've owned.

item.title: The Familiar
item.description: [#187] When I say we should do something sometime, I'm secretly hoping you'll say 'Why not now?'

item.title: Reload
item.description: [#188] And watch out for that guy from comic #53.

item.title: Exercise
item.description: [#189] I haven't had the patience for RPGs in a long time.

item.title: IPoD
item.description: [#190] For smaller numbers he has to SAVE lives. The birthrate channel is even more of a mixed bag.

item.title: Lojban
item.description: [#191] zo'o ta jitfa .i .e'o xu do pendo mi

item.title: Working for Google
item.description: [#192] I hear once you've worked there for 256 days they teach you the secret of levitation.

item.title: The Perfect Sound
item.description: [#193] Oh, what a pity, can't you understand . . .

item.title: Penises
item.description: [#194] The penis varies in size when flaccid and is pretty consistently about yea big when erect. Anyway, back to the sitcom one-liners and the constant flow of spam.

item.title: Map of the Internet
item.description: [#195] For the IPv6 map just imagine the XP default desktop picture.

item.title: Command Line Fu
item.description: [#196] When designing an interface, imagine that your program is all that stands between the user and hot, sweaty, tangled-bedsheets-fingertips-digging-into-the-back sex.

item.title: Ninja Turtles
item.description: [#197] The henchmen Bebop and Rocksteady have hijacked the musical genres for us just like the Lone Ranger hijacked the William Tell Overture for our parents.

item.title: Perspective
item.description: [#198] I wonder what I was dreaming to prompt that. I hope it wasn't the Richard Stallman Cirque de Soleil thing again.

item.title: Right-Hand Rule
item.description: [#199] To really expand your mind try some noncartesian porn. Edwin Abbot Abbott has nothing on 'Girls on Girls in Tightly Closed Nonorientable Spaces'.

item.title: Bill Nye
item.description: [#200] You could at least not wear the lab coat everywhere, dude.

item.title: Christmas GPS
item.description: [#201] If it's over water, and you can't get a boat or revise the rules to preserve the makeout, there is no helping you.

item.title: YouTube
item.description: [#202] I pray GunPistolMan never learns the word 'sheeple'.

item.title: Hallucinations
item.description: [#203] And the possibility of lucid dreaming just makes it that much more fascinating.

item.title: America
item.description: [#204] The younger folk in the audience think this is a joke.

item.title: Candy Button Paper
item.description: [#205] Nonrewritable tape?

item.title: Reno Rhymes
item.description: [#206] Did you shoot a man in Reno? Now, I don't mean to pry.

item.title: What xkcd Means
item.description: [#207] It means shuffling quickly past nuns on the street with ketchup in your palms, pretending you're hiding stigmata.

item.title: Regular Expressions
item.description: [#208] Wait, forgot to escape a space. Wheeeeee[taptaptap]eeeeee.

item.title: Kayak
item.description: [#209] Man, there's future *everywhere*.

item.title: 90's Flowchart
item.description: [#210] Freestyle rapping is basically applied Markov chains.

item.title: Hamster Ball Heist
item.description: [#211] First person to bring me Wayne Coyne in a hamster ball gets a free t-shirt! He gets one too.

item.title: Brain
item.description: [#212] The rest is fear of raptors.

item.title: Ghostbusters Marathon
item.description: [#213] If you walk out that door you'll be crossing the Rubicon with me, and that's one stream I'm not ready to cross.

item.title: The Problem with Wikipedia
item.description: [#214] 'Taft in a wet t-shirt contest' is the key image here.

item.title: Letting Go
item.description: [#215] At least I never gave her the root password.

item.title: Romantic Drama Equation
item.description: [#216] Real-life prospective-pairing curves over things like age can get depressing.

item.title: e to the pi Minus pi
item.description: [#217] Also, I hear the 4th root of (9^2 + 19^2/22) is pi.

item.title: Nintendo Surgeon
item.description: [#218] Scary thought #138: Raptors coming down the waterslide behind me.

item.title: Blanket Fort
item.description: [#219] Also, we have a fort out in the woods where we stashed that hooker's body.

item.title: Philosophy
item.description: [#220] It's like the squirt bottle we use with the cat.

item.title: Random Number
item.description: [#221] RFC 1149.5 specifies 4 as the standard IEEE-vetted random number.

item.title: Small Talk
item.description: [#222] But surely I owe you an accurate answer!

item.title: Valentine's Day
item.description: [#223] One of these days me and Joey Comeau will get around to subverting the hetero-normative paradigm and fixing all this.

item.title: Lisp
item.description: [#224] We lost the documentation on quantum mechanics. You'll have to decode the regexes yourself.

item.title: Open Source
item.description: [#225] Later we'll dress up like Big Oil thugs and jump Ralph Nader.

item.title: Swingset
item.description: [#226] Someone bring me a pocket fan so I can drift around the yard.

item.title: Color Codes
item.description: [#227] (It's the TMBG Dial-a-Song line, to save you some time.)

item.title: Resonance
item.description: [#228] It's really hard to control the frequency, actually.

item.title: Graffiti
item.description: [#229] FOR AN INTRIGUING TIME CALL

item.title: Hamiltonian
item.description: [#230] The problem with perspective is that it's bidirectional.

item.title: Cat Proximity
item.description: [#231] Yes you are! And you're sitting there! Hi, kitty!

item.title: Chess Enlightenment
item.description: [#232] You know that 'sweep the pieces off the board and see it in your mind' thing? Doesn't work.

item.title: A New CAPTCHA Approach
item.description: [#233] They'd use that Futurama episode with Fry's dog, but even spambots cry at that.

item.title: Escape Artist
item.description: [#234] Easier to escape: n-layered nested quotes or an iron maiden?

item.title: Kite
item.description: [#235] It's easy to regret your awkward conversations but hard to regret the ones you didn't have.

item.title: Collecting Double-Takes
item.description: [#236] Fun game: find a combination of two items that most freaks out the cashier. Winner: pregnancy test and single coat hanger.

item.title: Keyboards are Disgusting
item.description: [#237] Alternate method: convince them to pretend it's an Etch-a-Sketch and try to erase it.

item.title: Pet Peeve #114
item.description: [#238] I'm reading a goddamn book, thank you very much.

item.title: Blagofaire
item.description: [#239] Things were better before the Structuring and the Levels.

item.title: Dream Girl
item.description: [#240] No matter how elaborately you fool yourself.

item.title: Battle Room
item.description: [#241] Bean actually sabotaged it just to give Dink the excuse to make that joke.

item.title: The Difference
item.description: [#242] How could you choose avoiding a little pain over understanding a magic lightning machine?

item.title: Appropriate Term
item.description: [#243] I know a lot of people hate these, but I prefer them to touchpads.

item.title: Tabletop Roleplaying
item.description: [#244] I may have also tossed one of a pair of teleportation rings into the ocean, with interesting results.

item.title: Floor Tiles
item.description: [#245] The worst part is when sidewalk cracks are out-of-sync with your natural stride.

item.title: Labyrinth Puzzle
item.description: [#246] And the whole setup is just a trap to capture escaping logicians. None of the doors actually lead out.

item.title: Factoring the Time
item.description: [#247] I occasionally do this with mile markers on the highway.

item.title: Hypotheticals
item.description: [#248] What if someone broke out of a hypothetical situation in your room right now?

item.title: Chess Photo
item.description: [#249] We once tried playing blindfold chess on the Aerosmith ride at Disney World.

item.title: Snopes
item.description: [#250] The MythBusters are even more sinister.

item.title: CD Tray Fight
item.description: [#251] This is silly, of course. The enemy will be born in the network.

item.title: Escalators
item.description: [#252] The one time I tried, I got hit by a slinky going down at double speed.

item.title: Highway Engineer Pranks
item.description: [#253] Prank #11: Boston

item.title: Comic Fragment
item.description: [#254] No one wants an explanation more than us. Except Ms. Garofalo.

item.title: Subjectivity
item.description: [#255] Or maybe the slide is like Aslan, and gets taller as I do (except without the feeling of discomfort when I reach my teens and suddenly get the Christ stuff.)

item.title: Online Communities
item.description: [#256] I'm waiting for the day when, if you tell someone 'I'm from the internet', instead of laughing they just ask 'oh, what part?'

item.title: Code Talkers
item.description: [#257] As far as I can tell, Navajo doesn't have a common word for 'zero'. do-neh-lini means 'neutral'.

item.title: Conspiracy Theories
item.description: [#258] There are a lot of graduate-educated young-earth creationists.

item.title: Clichéd Exchanges
item.description: [#259] It's like they say, you gotta fight fire with clichés.

item.title: The Glass Necklace
item.description: [#260] Well, for some value of 'actually work'.

item.title: Regarding Mussolini
item.description: [#261] Constantly stopping these briefings halfway through is becoming a pain.

item.title: IN UR REALITY
item.description: [#262] Hey, at least I ran out of staples.

item.title: Certainty
item.description: [#263] a(b+c)=(ab)+(ac). Politicize that, bitches.

item.title: Choices: Part 1
item.description: [#264] Wait, damn, I think I spotted a new email on the last refresh.

item.title: Choices: Part 2
item.description: [#265] Maybe someday I'll get to write the Wikipedia article about this place! Wait, damn, original research.

item.title: Choices: Part 3
item.description: [#266] Wait, this is space -- how are you talking to me? And, as an afterthought, what's up with the hole in reality?

item.title: Choices: Part 4
item.description: [#267] Making out with yourself: now an official xkcd theme? Troubling.

item.title: Choices: Part 5
item.description: [#268] I wonder what percentage of not-obviously-busy people on the street would say yes to kite-flying with a stranger. This looks like a job for Science!

item.title: TCMP
item.description: [#269] A big obstacle in experimenting with the mind's dream-simulation-engine is holding onto the details as you wake up. With TCMP you can bring back any information you want.

item.title: Merlin
item.description: [#270] I mean, the black-and-white stuff was running backward, but it hardly mattered to the story.

item.title: Powers of One
item.description: [#271] It's kinda Zen when you think about it, if you don't think too hard.

item.title: Linux User at Best Buy
item.description: [#272] We actually stand around the antivirus displays with the Mac users just waiting for someone to ask.

item.title: Electromagnetic Spectrum
item.description: [#273] Sometimes I try to picture what everything would look like if the whole spectrum were compressed into the visible spectrum. Also sometimes I try to picture your sister naked.

item.title: With Apologies to The Who
item.description: [#274] Trivia: Roger Daltry originally wrote 'Don't try an' Digg what we all say' but erased the second 'g' when he moved to reddit.

item.title: Thoughts
item.description: [#275] And now I might never get to again.

item.title: Fixed Width
item.description: [#276] I wish I knew how to quit this so I wouldn't have to quit you.

item.title: Long Light
item.description: [#277] You can look at practically any part of anything manmade around you and think 'some engineer was frustrated while designing this.' It's a little human connection.

item.title: Black Hat Support
item.description: [#278] So as not to leave you hanging -- it was a problem with select() calls.

item.title: Pickup Lines
item.description: [#279] That shirt looks good on you, but it would look even better stuffed into the neck of a vodka bottle and flung burning through our office building's window. Let's fucking do it and never look back.

item.title: Librarians
item.description: [#280] Don't expect any leniency on late fees, though.

item.title: Online Package Tracking
item.description: [#281] I don't even *want* this package! Why did I join the stinging insect of the month club, anyway?

item.title: Organic Fuel
item.description: [#282] I have nothing to apologize for.

item.title: Projection
item.description: [#283] Out in a field, not another car for miles, silence but for the rain drumming on the sunroof, warm thick folds of the blanket hiding wordless fingertip games ...

item.title: Tape Measure
item.description: [#284] This sequence was later reproduced in the International Tape-Extending Federation archives, retitled 'The Founding of the Sport'.

item.title: Wikipedian Protester
item.description: [#285] SEMI-PROTECT THE CONSTITUTION

item.title: All Your Base
item.description: [#286] The AYB retro-return-date (Zero Wing Zero Hour) should be around AD 2021.

item.title: NP-Complete
item.description: [#287] General solutions get you a 50% tip.

item.title: Elevator
item.description: [#288] Quick, try it with 'LOVE'.

item.title: Alone
item.description: [#289] Worries assuaged, the numbers become less important than your touches.

item.title: Fucking Blue Shells
item.description: [#290] You can evade blue shells in Double Dash, but it is deep magic.

item.title: Dignified
item.description: [#291] 'I don't know, why is your beret staying on your head?' 'Staples.'

item.title: goto
item.description: [#292] Neal Stephenson thinks it's cute to name his labels 'dengo'

item.title: RTFM
item.description: [#293] Life is too short for man pages, but occasionally much too short without them.

item.title: Bookstore
item.description: [#294] You can search it if you want, but you may want to skip the memories of your mom.

item.title: DNE
item.description: [#295] I've seen advertisers put their URLs on chalkboards, encircled with a DNE. They went unerased for months. If you see this, feel free to replace the URL with xkcd.com.

item.title: Tony Hawk
item.description: [#296] Bad idea #271: Dropping into the half-pipe on a Segway.

item.title: Lisp Cycles
item.description: [#297] I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the MIT computer science program permanently.

item.title: Tesla Coil
item.description: [#298] For scientists, this can be the hardest thing about dreams.

item.title: Aeris Dies
item.description: [#299] It's bad enough that all the families in your Sims are just you and Maggie recreated over and over.

item.title: Facebook
item.description: [#300] 'Here, I'll put my number in your cell pho -- wait, why is it already here?'

item.title: Limerick
item.description: [#301] Fun game: try to post a YouTube comment so stupid that people realize you must be joking. (Hint: this is impossible)

item.title: Names
item.description: [#302] I'm always so happy that I successfully navigated the introduction that I completely forget to pay attention to the name the other person told me.

item.title: Compiling
item.description: [#303] 'Are you stealing those LCDs?' 'Yeah, but I'm doing it while my code compiles.'

item.title: Nighttime Stories
item.description: [#304] Cue angry letters from all seven fans of Xenocide.

item.title: Rule 34
item.description: [#305] Okay, Lance. For entry into the college bowl, spell 'Throbbing'

item.title: Orphaned Projects
item.description: [#306] His date works for Red Hat, who hired a coach for her, too. He advised her to 'rent lots of movies like Hitch. Guys love those.'

item.title: Excessive Quotation
item.description: [#307] Unfortunately for her, real Star Wars fans are attracted to a gal with a good force choke.

item.title: Interesting Life
item.description: [#308] Quick, fashion a climbing harness out of cat-6 cable and follow me down.

item.title: Shopping Teams
item.description: [#309] I am never going out to buy an air conditioner with my sysadmin again.

item.title: Commitment
item.description: [#310] Could be worse. The last guy in that situation fell for one of the transient trumpeting angels.

item.title: Action Movies
item.description: [#311] By my count, only 48 of the 158 minutes in Live Free or Die Hard have action. That's pathetic, guys. Crank is better, but needs a bigger budget and more Summer Glau.

item.title: With Apologies to Robert Frost
item.description: [#312] Some say the world will end in fire; some say in segfaults.

item.title: Insomnia
item.description: [#313] Crap, I have levitation class at 25:131. Better set the alarm to 'cinnamon'.

item.title: Dating Pools
item.description: [#314] The full analysis is of course much more complicated, but I can't stay to talk about it because I have a date.

item.title: Braille
item.description: [#315] The only big difference I've seen is in colors. Where the regular text reads 'press red button', the braille reads 'press two-inch button'.

item.title: Loud Sex
item.description: [#316] Spherical or parabolic reflectors would of course lead to aberrant behavior.

item.title: That Lovin' Feelin'
item.description: [#317] Maybe there's no tenderness in her fingertips either, but at least SHE puts out.

item.title: Nostalgia
item.description: [#318] If you don't get this one, don't google it.

item.title: Engineering Hubris
item.description: [#319] Chuck Jones is a vengeful god.

item.title: 28-Hour Day
item.description: [#320] Small print: this schedule will eventually drive one stark raving mad.

item.title: Thighs
item.description: [#321] My thighs have seen the glory of the coming of the Lord?

item.title: Pix Plz
item.description: [#322] But one of the regulars in the channel is a girl!

item.title: Ballmer Peak
item.description: [#323] Apple uses automated schnapps IVs.

item.title: Tapping
item.description: [#324] Sometimes the best fun looks like boredom.

item.title: A-Minus-Minus
item.description: [#325] You can do this one in every 30 times and still have 97% positive feedback.

item.title: Effect an Effect
item.description: [#326] Time to paint another grammarian silhouette on the side of the desktop.

item.title: Exploits of a Mom
item.description: [#327] Her daughter is named Help I'm trapped in a driver's license factory.

item.title: Eggs
item.description: [#328] Oh, yeah, we get tons of them at these casual sex bars.

item.title: Turing Test
item.description: [#329] Hit Turing right in the test-ees.

item.title: Indecision
item.description: [#330] Hey, I don't make the rules. It's in the book.

item.title: Photoshops
item.description: [#331] When I look into your eyes, I see JPEG artifacts. I can tell by the pixels that we're wrong for each other.

item.title: Gyroscopes
item.description: [#332] We didn't actually land on the moon -- it just looked like we did because of precession. Also, gyroscopes caused 9/11.

item.title: Getting Out of Hand
item.description: [#333] Wikipedia's role as brain-extension, while a little troubling, is also really cool.

item.title: Wasteland
item.description: [#334] You make forgetting look so easy.

item.title: Mattress
item.description: [#335] The TempurPedic wineglass guy broke his ankle.

item.title: Priorities
item.description: [#336] You should start giving out 'E's so I can spell FACADE or DEFACED.

item.title: Post Office Showdown
item.description: [#337] That track ('Battle Without Honor or Humanity') -- like 'Ride of the Valkyries' -- improves *any* activity.

item.title: Future
item.description: [#338] But the past was much too cramped!

item.title: Classic
item.description: [#339] Someone get that Pachelbel's Canon kid a recording contract, stat.

item.title: Fight
item.description: [#340] And she put sweet nothings in all my .conf files. It'll take me forever to get X working again.

item.title: 1337: Part 1
item.description: [#341] If you're not cool enough to do it manually, you can look up tools like Upside-Down-Ternet for playing games with people on your wifi.

item.title: 1337: Part 2
item.description: [#342] Trivia: Elaine is actually her middle name.

item.title: 1337: Part 3
item.description: [#343] I once asked an NSA guy whether they'd broken RSA. And I know I can trust him, because I asked if he was lying to me and he said no.

item.title: 1337: Part 4
item.description: [#344] Mrs. Roberts would have gotten up sooner, of course, but she was busy piping find ~ and find ~nomad into xargs shred, just in case.

item.title: 1337: Part 5
item.description: [#345] This digital music thing will probably reach its endgame sometime in the next decade or so. These are very exciting times.

item.title: Diet Coke+Mentos
item.description: [#346] The cola+Mentos trick is up there with corn starch+water (vibrating platter optional) in scientific coolness out of common kitchen supplies.

item.title: Brick Archway
item.description: [#347] The TI-86 was bad enough. I don't know how I'd have gotten through high school if I'd had a laptop+wifi.

item.title: Close to You
item.description: [#348] We should probably talk about this before the wedding.

item.title: Success
item.description: [#349] 40% of OpenBSD installs lead to shark attacks. It's their only standing security issue.

item.title: Network
item.description: [#350] Viruses so far have been really disappointing on the 'disable the internet' front, and time is running out. When Linux/Mac win in a decade or so the game will be over.

item.title: Trolling
item.description: [#351] And I was really impressed with how they managed to shock the Goatse guy.

item.title: Far Away
item.description: [#352] Sometimes an impulsive 2:00 AM cross-country trip is the only solution.

item.title: Python
item.description: [#353] I wrote 20 short programs in Python yesterday. It was wonderful. Perl, I'm leaving you.

item.title: Startling
item.description: [#354] We actually reached the future about three years ago.

item.title: Couple
item.description: [#355] Facebook defines relationships. 'Yeah, we would have broken up last night, but the net connection was down.'

item.title: Nerd Sniping
item.description: [#356] I first saw this problem on the Google Labs Aptitude Test. A professor and I filled a blackboard without getting anywhere. Have fun.

item.title: Flies
item.description: [#357] I don't know about houseflies, but we definitely caught a lot of fruit flies with our vinegar bowl. Hooray science!

item.title: Loud Party
item.description: [#358] I'm glad this is so much fun because I'm not sure how we're getting down.

item.title: Rock Band
item.description: [#359] I'm gonna have to add something to the strum bar so it makes a clicky sound like the old controllers. I'm so used to the feedback; the silence throws me off.

item.title: Writers Strike
item.description: [#360] He's just jealous because everyone's up in the attic listening to Stephen Colbert.

item.title: Christmas Back Home
item.description: [#361] Family going to bed at 10 PM is so much worse than jet lag.

item.title: Blade Runner
item.description: [#362] Blade Runner: Classic, but incredibly slow.

item.title: Reset
item.description: [#363] Clearance for this Sign: 11 Feet

item.title: Responsible Behavior
item.description: [#364] Never bring tequila to a key-signing party.

item.title: Slides
item.description: [#365] Did you know they can actually physically throw you out of SIGGRAPH?

item.title: Your Mom
item.description: [#366] 'It's either 'your mom' jokes or me' 'Then I, like so many men before me, must reluctantly choose your mom.'

item.title: Fandom
item.description: [#367] Ron Paul wants to put the New Republic back on the Corusca gem standard.

item.title: Bass
item.description: [#368] And sometimes I use it to retaliate against the guy upstairs with the loud girlfriend and the elliptical dish.

item.title: Dangers
item.description: [#369] Zero results: 'snake charming' and 'haberdashery'. (Things like 'car' and 'boating' and such are of course the highest, by a huge margin.)

item.title: Redwall
item.description: [#370] My Redwall/Jurassic Park crossover fanfic is almost complete!

item.title: Compiler Complaint
item.description: [#371] Checking whether build environment is sane ... build environment is grinning and holding a spatula. Guess not.

item.title: To Be Wanted
item.description: [#372] Or so I hope?

item.title: The Data So Far
item.description: [#373] But THIS guy, he might be for real!

item.title: Journal
item.description: [#374] And the journal is filled with all the things I'd say to her if I were nice like you. I burn it when it's full.

item.title: Pod Bay Doors
item.description: [#375] As they're both unplugged, they do a lovely Daisy Daisy/Still Alive duet.

item.title: Bug
item.description: [#376] The universe started in 1970. Anyone claiming to be over 38 is lying about their age.

item.title: Journal 2
item.description: [#377] That's my hat! You took my hat!

item.title: Real Programmers
item.description: [#378] Real programmers set the universal constants at the start such that the universe evolves to contain the disk with the data they want.

item.title: Forgetting
item.description: [#379] Of course, the assert doesn't work.

item.title: Emoticon
item.description: [#380] U+FDD0 is actually Unicode for the eye of the basilisk, though for safety reasons no font actually renders it.

item.title: Mobius Battle
item.description: [#381] Films need to do this more, if only to piss off the people who have to feed it into the projector.

item.title: Trebuchet
item.description: [#382] It was also fun when those teenagers tried to egg our house and it insta-cooked the eggs in mid-air.

item.title: Helping
item.description: [#383] Oh, look, the 'make everything better' button was here behind the bookshelf all along.

item.title: The Drake Equation
item.description: [#384] But seriously, there's loads of intelligent life. It's just not screaming constantly in all directions on the handful of frequencies we search.

item.title: How it Works
item.description: [#385] It's pi plus C, of course.

item.title: Duty Calls
item.description: [#386] What do you want me to do? LEAVE? Then they'll keep being wrong!

item.title: Advanced Technology
item.description: [#387] We are sexy, sexy Von Neumann machines.

item.title: Fuck Grapefruit
item.description: [#388] Coconuts are so far down to the left they couldn't be fit on the chart. Ever spent half an hour trying to open a coconut with a rock? Fuck coconuts.

item.title: Keeping Time
item.description: [#389] You can identify them ahead-of-time -- they lead with their left foot when the music starts.

item.title: Nightmares
item.description: [#390] Well, *I* think I'm real. Look at me. Look at my face. Cut me and I'll bleed. What more do you want? Please don't go.

item.title: Anti-Mindvirus
item.description: [#391] I'm as surprised as you! I didn't think it was possible.

item.title: Making Rules
item.description: [#392] I never understood why someone would expect me to accept their rules right after they'd punched me. I'm sure it's all very symbolic or something.

item.title: Ultimate Game
item.description: [#393] RIP, Gary.

item.title: Kilobyte
item.description: [#394] I would take 'kibibyte' more seriously if it didn't sound so much like 'Kibbles N Bits'.

item.title: Morning
item.description: [#395] I'd press on them to try to unstick them, but I can't reach. Can we try cycling day and night really fast?

item.title: The Ring
item.description: [#396] On the other hand, poor Samara -- transcoded to FLV. No one deserves that.

item.title: Unscientific
item.description: [#397] Last week, we busted the myth that electroweak gauge symmetry is broken by the Higgs mechanism. We'll also examine the existence of God and whether true love exists.

item.title: Tap That Ass
item.description: [#398] Hey, when you're done draining the syrup, just leave the hole, okay?

item.title: Travelling Salesman Problem
item.description: [#399] What's the complexity class of the best linear programming cutting-plane techniques? I couldn't find it anywhere. Man, the Garfield guy doesn't have these problems ...

item.title: Important Life Lesson
item.description: [#400] I didn't even know I *had* the Monty Python 'Lumberjack' song.

item.title: Large Hadron Collider
item.description: [#401] When charged particles of more than 5 TeV pass through a bubble chamber, they leave a trail of candy.

item.title: 1,000 Miles North
item.description: [#402] Twister would've been a much better movie if they'd cut out the bad-guy storm chaser and all the emotional romance crap. All you need for a good movie are tornados and scientists. Actually, that's all you need for anything.

item.title: Convincing Pickup Line
item.description: [#403] Check it out; I've had sex with someone who's had sex with someone who's written a paper with Paul Erds!

item.title: Journal 3
item.description: [#405] Oh, and, uh, if the Russian government asks, that submarine was always there.

item.title: Venting
item.description: [#406] P.P.S. I can kill you with my brain.

item.title: Cheap GPS
item.description: [#407] In lieu of mapping software, I once wrote a Perl program which, given a USB GPS receiver and a destination, printed 'LEFT' 'RIGHT' OR 'STRAIGHT' based on my heading.

item.title: Overqualified
item.description: [#408] To anyone I've taken on a terrible date, this is retroactively my cover story.

item.title: Electric Skateboard (Double Comic)
item.description: [#409] Unsafe vehicles, hills, and philosophy go hand in hand.

item.title: Math Paper
item.description: [#410] That's nothing. I once lost my genetics, rocketry, and stripping licenses in a single incident.

item.title: Techno
item.description: [#411] I don't know what's worse -- that there exists broken-hard-drive-sound techno, or that it's not half bad.

item.title: Startled
item.description: [#412] ...

item.title: New Pet
item.description: [#413] ONE LAPTOP PER HAMSTER!

item.title: Mistranslations
item.description: [#414] Oh, I think this word might mean 'Crisco'!

item.title: Restraining Order
item.description: [#415] On Mondays I go running, so you'll have to get up early and follow along on a parallel street. What fun!

item.title: Zealous Autoconfig
item.description: [#416] I hear this is an option in the latest Ubuntu release.

item.title: The Man Who Fell Sideways
item.description: [#417] Strip originally conceived in conversation with Jeph Jacques. Soon to be a major motion picture.

item.title: Stove Ownership
item.description: [#418] Although maybe it's just a phase, like freshman year of college when I realized I could just buy frosting in a can.

item.title: Forks and Spoons
item.description: [#419] Their biggest mistake was bringing Rachael Ray and Emeril to tour the lab and sign off on the project. That's when Spielberg caught wind of it.

item.title: Jealousy
item.description: [#420] Oh, huh, so you didn't know that story?

item.title: Making Hash Browns
item.description: [#421] There are at least fourteen ways this could go badly (seventeen if that fork is a dangerous crossbreed.)

item.title: A Better Idea
item.description: [#422] It's *almost* enough to make me want to redo high school.

item.title: Finish Line
item.description: [#423] The question with Lucy and the football was always whether, on some level, she believed the things she said.

item.title: Security Holes
item.description: [#424] True story: I had to try several times to upload this comic because my ssh key was blacklisted.

item.title: Fortune Cookies
item.description: [#425] 'You will have hot, steamy, sweaty sex ... IN BED!'

item.title: Geohashing
item.description: [#426] Saturday is game night.

item.title: Bad Timing
item.description: [#427] Protip: Even without the red spiders, never have that conversation halfway through a balloon ride.

item.title: Starwatching
item.description: [#428] I always figured the word 'blog' would sound *less* silly as the years went by.

item.title: Fantasy
item.description: [#429] I guess if she accepted irrational realities, she'd hardly be my fantasy.

item.title: Every Damn Morning
item.description: [#430] There was something about a cup and a sword and a tree and a green hill ...

item.title: Delivery
item.description: [#431] Ma'am, I admit that wasn't in the best taste, but you have to admire my delivery! Ha ha, get it? Oh God, don't throw those syringes! Your baby's fine!

item.title: Journal 4
item.description: [#432] Man, this emo shit was supposed to be for people who didn't have hats.

item.title: Journal 5
item.description: [#433] 'Pick you up at eight?' 'Nine. I've got to re-mine the driveway.'

item.title: xkcd Goes to the Airport
item.description: [#434] Under three ounces, but it stains panties.

item.title: Purity
item.description: [#435] On the other hand, physicists like to say physics is to math as sex is to masturbation.

item.title: How it Happened
item.description: [#436] I was there, dude.

item.title: SUV
item.description: [#437] Electric skateboards, by cost, get the equivalent of about 300 miles per gallon. Lithium batteries just need to get cheaper.

item.title: Internet Argument
item.description: [#438] It's easier to be an asshole to words than to people.

item.title: Thinking Ahead
item.description: [#439] Did he just go crazy and jump out the window?

item.title: Road Rage
item.description: [#440] Okay, now just as the loss hits him, slam on the brakes.

item.title: Babies
item.description: [#441] I bet my future kids will read this someday. DEAR FUTURE KIDS: how did you get internet in the cellar?

item.title: xkcd Loves the Discovery Channel
item.description: [#442] I love the title-text!

item.title: Know Your Vines
item.description: [#443] Friggin' modern tents don't have a single piece of rope.

item.title: Macgyver Gets Lazy
item.description: [#444] At the time of this writing, Wikipedia has a wonderful article titled 'List of problems solved by Macgyver'.

item.title: I Am Not Good with Boomerangs
item.description: [#445] Bonus strip: just read the rightmost panels straight down.

item.title: In Popular Culture
item.description: [#446] Someday the 'in popular culture' section will have its own article with an 'in popular culture' section. It will reference this title-text referencing it, and the blogosphere will implode.

item.title: Too Old For This Shit
item.description: [#447] They say if a mathematician doesn't do their great work by age eleven, they never will.

item.title: Good Morning
item.description: [#448] As my standard, I use going to sleep at midnight and waking up at 8 AM.

item.title: Things Fall Apart
item.description: [#449] 'I'm nothing without you' is a fucked-up sentiment.

item.title: The Sea
item.description: [#450] And then a second one, to drain the sea.

item.title: Impostor
item.description: [#451] If you think this is too hard on literary criticism, read the Wikipedia article on deconstruction.

item.title: Mission
item.description: [#452] Don't you know? The chances of a random object being a scone are about one in six.

item.title: Upcoming Hurricanes
item.description: [#453] I'd like to see more damage assessments for hurricanes hitting New York and flooding Manhattan -- something like the 1938 Long Island Express, but aimed a bit more to the west. It's just a matter of time.

item.title: Rewiring
item.description: [#454] My friend Finn tried to mail one end of the cable to me and thread the mail system.

item.title: Hats
item.description: [#455] ...

item.title: Cautionary
item.description: [#456] This really is a true story, and she doesn't know I put it in my comic because her wifi hasn't worked for weeks.

item.title: Frustration
item.description: [#457] 'Don't worry, I can do it in under a minute.' 'Yes, I've noticed.'

item.title: Regrets
item.description: [#458] And nothing for 'I'm glad I saw Epic Movie.'

item.title: Holy Ghost
item.description: [#459] Okay, everyone, cross yourselves, then cross the streams.

item.title: Paleontology
item.description: [#460] Dinosaurs totally jumped the ichthyosaur when they got rid of Brontosaurus.

item.title: Google Maps
item.description: [#461] Apparently Google assumes you're traveling during the ferry's normal operating hours. We lost two hours circling that damn lake (to say nothing of the Straw Man).

item.title: Freemanic Paracusia
item.description: [#462] It's amazing what it does for YouTube comments.

item.title: Voting Machines
item.description: [#463] And that's *another* crypto conference I've been kicked out of. C'mon, it's a great analogy!

item.title: RBA
item.description: [#464] This is a story all about how I started drinking.

item.title: Quantum Teleportation
item.description: [#465] Science should be exactly as cool as the headlines sound. Like the 'RUSSIANS CUT APART AND REASSEMBLE DOGS' thing.

item.title: Moving
item.description: [#466] We need a special holiday to honor the countless kind souls with unsecured networks named 'linksys'.

item.title: X Girls Y Cups
item.description: [#467] Also no results: 1girl10000cups, 2girls(5+3i)cups, 65536girls65536cups, or 3frenchhens2turtledoves1cup.

item.title: Fetishes
item.description: [#468] They eventually resolved this self-reference, but Cantor's 'everything-in-the-fetish-book-twice' parties finally sunk the idea.

item.title: Improvised
item.description: [#469] Oh, your brother is Luke. Sorry, should've mentioned that first.

item.title: The End is Not for a While
item.description: [#470] I THINK EVERYONE INVOLVED HERE IS CUTE.

item.title: Aversion Fads
item.description: [#471] Hey, are you friends with any hamsters? This kite needs a passenger.

item.title: House of Pancakes
item.description: [#472] Fuck it. I'm just going to Waffle House.

item.title: Still Raw
item.description: [#473] We actually divorced once over the airplane/treadmill argument. (Preemptive response to the inevitable threads arguing about it: you're all wrong on the internet.)

item.title: Turn-On
item.description: [#474] Supercollider? I 'ardly know 'er!

item.title: Further Boomerang Difficulties
item.description: [#475] An eternity later, the universe having turned out to have positive curvature and lots of mass, the boomerang hits him in the back of the head.

item.title: One-Sided
item.description: [#476] He continued, 'Okay, Bernanke is uncontaminated. Find a crossbow and get him into position behind one of the columns at the Fed entrance. This is gonna get ugly.'

item.title: Typewriter
item.description: [#477] Somewhere in the world, my actual grandmothers are reading this and angrily exclaiming that I never write even malformed thank-you notes. DEAR GRANDMOMS: I AM SORRY! YOU ARE WONDERFUL PEOPLE AND THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING. LOVE reddit.com RANDALL.

item.title: The Staple Madness
item.description: [#478] Staple guns: because duct tape can't make that 'kaCHUNK' noise.

item.title: Tones
item.description: [#479] I need a lawn, so I can yell at kids to stay off it.

item.title: Spore
item.description: [#480] Way to not support the GMA 950 under OS X, Spore. :(

item.title: Listen to Yourself
item.description: [#481] Man, I just wanted to know how babby was formed.

item.title: Height
item.description: [#482] Interestingly, on a true vertical log plot, I think the Eiffel Tower's sides really would be straight lines.

item.title: Fiction Rule of Thumb
item.description: [#483] Except for anything by Lewis Carroll or Tolkien, you get five made-up words per story. I'm looking at you, Anathem.

item.title: Flash Games
item.description: [#484] Although ... who else can't wait for them to incorporate that Wiimote head-tracking stuff into games? Man, the future's gonna be *awesome*.

item.title: Depth
item.description: [#485] The Planck length is another thousand or two pixels below the comic.

item.title: I am Not a Ninja
item.description: [#486] 'The sad thing is that I just wanted to talk about your poor smoke-bomb techniques.'

item.title: Numerical Sex Positions
item.description: [#487] We didn't even get to the continued fractions!

item.title: Steal This Comic
item.description: [#488] I spent more time trying to get an audible.com audio book playing than it took to listen to the book. I have lost every other piece of DRM-locked music I have paid for.

item.title: Going West
item.description: [#489] Listen, they request that you stop submitting a listing for your house labeled 'WHERE YOU BROKE MY HEART'.

item.title: Morning Routine
item.description: [#490] I had a really hard time not writing '... profit!'

item.title: Twitter
item.description: [#491] If long tooltips / cut off for you / then upgrade from / Firefox 2 / Burma Shave

item.title: Scrabble
item.description: [#492] A veteran Scrabble player will spot the 'OSTRICH' option.

item.title: Actuarial
item.description: [#493] I started to do the tables for more famous people but it got really depressing and morbid and I had to go outside. Hat guy wins again.

item.title: Secretary: Part 1
item.description: [#494] The blueprints for the Department of the Internet offices call for Ceiling Cat-themed sprinkler heads.

item.title: Secretary: Part 2
item.description: [#495] That helmet won't save him.

item.title: Secretary: Part 3
item.description: [#496] He actually installed each piece in a different car in the lot, then built a new car in the spot from the displaced pieces. It's a confusing maneuver known as the auto-troll shuffle.

item.title: Secretary: Part 4
item.description: [#497] It's time to draw the line.

item.title: Secretary: Part 5
item.description: [#498] And they choose Al Gore as Internet Secretary.

item.title: Scantron
item.description: [#499] Also, after all the warnings about filling in the bubbles completely, I spent like 30 seconds on each one.

item.title: Election
item.description: [#500] Someday I'll be rich enough to hire Nate Silver to help make all my life decisions. 'Should I sleep with her?' 'Well, I'm showing a 35% chance it will end badly.'

item.title: Faust 2.0
item.description: [#501] The only blood these contracts are signed in is from me cutting my hand trying to open the goddamn CD case.

item.title: Dark Flow
item.description: [#502] The Pioneer anomaly is due to the force of my love.

item.title: Terminology
item.description: [#503] Also, is it just me, or do Japan and New Zealand look suspiciously similar? Has anyone seen them at a party together?

item.title: Legal Hacks
item.description: [#504] It's totally a reasonable modern analogue. Jefferson would have been all about crypto.

item.title: A Bunch of Rocks
item.description: [#505] I call Rule 34 on Wolfram's Rule 34.

item.title: Theft of the Magi
item.description: [#506] Every Roomba needs a dueling harness.

item.title: Experimentation
item.description: [#507] I understand large sample sizes are key to a low standard error of the mean, but the entire sophomore class?

item.title: Drapes
item.description: [#508] Wait, what?

item.title: Induced Current
item.description: [#509] The MythBusters need to tackle whether a black hole from the LHC could REALLY destroy the world.

item.title: Egg Drop Failure
item.description: [#510] I hear my brother Ricky won his school's egg drop by leaving the egg inside the hen.

item.title: Sleet
item.description: [#511] I mean, I can barely hear myself complaining about Battlestar Galactica.

item.title: Alternate Currency
item.description: [#512] For the first time ever, the phrase 'I'd like to thank everyone at 4chan for making me successful and happy' is uttered.

item.title: Friends
item.description: [#513] Friends with detriments.

item.title: Simultaneous
item.description: [#514] I'm leaving you for your twin. He's more mature than you by now.

item.title: No One Must Know
item.description: [#515] Or perhaps they knew he was there, and were just trying to torment him first.

item.title: Wood Chips
item.description: [#516] You didn't run a chemical analysis against the Shroud of Turin? Man, all that work for NOTHING.

item.title: Marshmallow Gun
item.description: [#517] Except in reality crossing a stream of marshmallows would create a giant Bill Murray.

item.title: Flow Charts
item.description: [#518] At 8 drinks, you switch the torrent from FreeBSD to Microsoft Bob. C'mon, it'll be fun!

item.title: 11th Grade
item.description: [#519] And the ten minutes striking up a conversation with that strange kid in homeroom sometimes matters more than every other part of high school combined.

item.title: Cuttlefish
item.description: [#520] Unless the CS students finish the robot revolution before you finish the cephalopod one.

item.title: 2008 Christmas Special
item.description: [#521] 'How could you possibly think typing 'import skynet' was a good idea?'

item.title: Google Trends
item.description: [#522] Obama has been writing Lincoln/Obama erotic fan fiction on his secret livejournal. Excerpt: Lincoln lay back on the bed, nude save for his trademark stovepipe hat. 'Tell me,' he purred seductively, as he and Obama formed a more perfect union. 'When you come, is it 10% ethanol?'

item.title: Decline
item.description: [#523] 'There's also a spike on the Fourier transform at the one-month mark where --' 'You want to stop talking right now.'

item.title: Party
item.description: [#524] I wonder what 2008 meme will go bizarrely mainstream in 2009 like Rickrolling did 2007-2008. I Accidentally ? Yo dawg? Place your bets now!

item.title: I Know You're Listening
item.description: [#525] It's basically Pascal's Wager for the paranoid prankster.

item.title: Converting to Metric
item.description: [#526] According to River, 'adequate' vacuuming systems drain the human body at about half a liter per second.

item.title: Keynote
item.description: [#527] He should be better soon -- now that the Apple Store is getting rid of DRM, Cory Doctorow will get rid of his Steve Jobs voodoo doll.

item.title: Windows 7
item.description: [#528] Disclaimer: I have not actually tried the beta yet. I hear it's quite pleasant and hardly Hitler-y at all.

item.title: Sledding Discussion
item.description: [#529] If you get your hands on that one, it's the worst place to have a breaking-up conversation.

item.title: I'm An Idiot
item.description: [#530] Sadly, this is a true story. At least I learned about the OS X 'say' command.

item.title: Contingency Plan
item.description: [#531] Kids are genetic experiments. We're just experimenting responsibly!

item.title: Piano
item.description: [#532] Good thing he didn't make it smaller, or it'd need someone three inches tall to play it.

item.title: Laptop Hell
item.description: [#533] The xkcd.com sysadmin has a Q2010, and I can attest that it can handle a fall down several flight of concrete steps. Relatedly, he's upset with me -- I hope he doesn't take revenge by messing with my site's contenDISREGARD THAT I SUCK COCKS

item.title: Genetic Algorithms
item.description: [#534] Just make sure you don't have it maximize instead of minimize.

item.title: It Might Be Cool
item.description: [#535] 'And ovaries. Man, ovaries, huh?' [awkward pause] '... faithfully.'

item.title: Space Elevators
item.description: [#536] If you think space elevators are good, but just too boring and practical, check out the 'space fountain'.

item.title: Ducklings
item.description: [#537] DUCKLOOP'D?

item.title: Security
item.description: [#538] Actual actual reality: nobody cares about his secrets. (Also, I would be hard-pressed to find that wrench for $5.)

item.title: Boyfriend
item.description: [#539] ... okay, but because you said that, we're breaking up.

item.title: Base System
item.description: [#540] I once got to second base with a basketball player. She was so confused.

item.title: TED Talk
item.description: [#541] The IAU ban came after the 'redefinition of 'planet' to include the IAU president's mom' incident.

item.title: Cover-Up
item.description: [#542] Man, this trick has saved me so many times.

item.title: Sierpinski Valentine
item.description: [#543] Especially you mouseover-text readers. You're the best. <3

item.title: Pep Talk
item.description: [#544] Listen! They said a team of chess players coached by someone with no understanding of basketball would never be competitive in the NBA! Well, it turns out they're pretty perceptive.

item.title: Neutrality Schmeutrality
item.description: [#545] 'Hey, everyone, you can totally trust that I didn't do a word count on MY edit!'

item.title: Music DRM
item.description: [#546] Just yesterday I bought my first non-DRM'd songs (The Last Vegas, in keeping with my 'I only listen to things from Guitar Hero' theme).

item.title: Simple
item.description: [#547] Actually, I think if all higher math professors had to write for the Simple English Wikipedia for a year, we'd be in much better shape academically.

item.title: Kindle
item.description: [#548] I'm happy with my Kindle 2 so far, but if they cut off the free Wikipedia browsing, I plan to show up drunk on Jeff Bezos's lawn and refuse to leave.

item.title: Westley's a Dick
item.description: [#549] Inigo/Buttercup 4eva <3

item.title: Density
item.description: [#550] If only I had asked 4chan for ideas for what I should do to prevent this!

item.title: Etch-a-Sketch
item.description: [#551] Surrounded by boring mysteries.

item.title: Correlation
item.description: [#552] Correlation doesn't imply causation, but it does waggle its eyebrows suggestively and gesture furtively while mouthing 'look over there'.

item.title: Pirate Bay
item.description: [#553] We find you guilty of closing your torrents as soon as they finish. Your sentence is unremovable Hungarian subtitles on everything.

item.title: Not Enough Work
item.description: [#554] It's even harder if you're an asshole who pronounces <> brackets.

item.title: Two Mirrors
item.description: [#555] If you actually do this, what really happens is Douglas Hofstadter appears and talks to you for eight hours about strange loops.

item.title: Alternative Energy Revolution
item.description: [#556] The moment their arms spun freely in our air, they were doomed -- for Man has earned his right to hold this planet against all comers, by virtue of occasionally producing someone totally batshit insane.

item.title: Students
item.description: [#557] The same goes for the one where you're wrestling the Green Ranger in the swimming pool full of Crisco. You guys all have that dream, right? It's not just me. Right?

item.title: 1000 Times
item.description: [#558] And 0.002 dollars will NEVER equal 0.002 cents.

item.title: No Pun Intended
item.description: [#559] Like spelling 'dammit' correctly -- with two m's -- it's a troll that works best on the most literate.

item.title: Lithium Batteries
item.description: [#560] I'm normally a pretty frugal person, but I still compulsively buy any R/C aircraft that's less than $30. In the last few years, this has become a problem.

item.title: Well
item.description: [#561] I'll concede ergonomics anecdotally, but none of the studies of Dvorak were at all rigorous (the most-cited Navy study was overseen by Dvorak himself). And the 'slow typists down' thing is a myth. Also EMACS RULES VI DROOLS WOOOOOOO!

item.title: Parking
item.description: [#562] Police reported three dozen cheerful bystanders, yet no one claims to have seen who did it.

item.title: Fermirotica
item.description: [#563] I love how Google handles dimensional analysis. Stats are ballpark and vary wildly by time of day and whether your mom is in town.

item.title: Crossbows
item.description: [#564] I hate being the slowest guy in the lab.

item.title: Security Question
item.description: [#565] Let's invite him to a party and play 'I never'. Okay, I never hid any bodies SOUTH of Main Street. ... he's taking a drink!

item.title: Matrix Revisited
item.description: [#566] I actually remember being entertained by both the sequels while in the theater. They just don't hold up nearly as well in later comparison.

item.title: Urgent Mission
item.description: [#567] Sure, we could stop dictators and pandemics, but we could also make the signs on every damn diagram make sense.

item.title: Well 2
item.description: [#568] But I've made $13.72 already today! Ow, stop throwing pennies.

item.title: Borders
item.description: [#569] Eventually a UN is set up. And then a lone rebel runs down the line of flags in front of it, runs back to his base, and gets a kajillion points.

item.title: New Car
item.description: [#570] Somewhere out there is a company that has actually figured out how to enlarge penises, and it's helpless to reach potential customers.

item.title: Can't Sleep
item.description: [#571] If androids someday DO dream of electric sheep, don't forget to declare sheepCount as a long int.

item.title: Together
item.description: [#572] This scavenger hunt is getting boring. Let's go work on the treehouse!

item.title: Parental Trolling
item.description: [#573] They'll pick music and culture that they know annoys you. Building in behavioral easter eggs is a fair retaliation!

item.title: Swine Flu
item.description: [#574] Bad flu epidemics can hit young adults hardest because they provoke their powerful immune systems into overreaction, so to stay healthy spend the next few weeks drunk and sleep-deprived to keep yours suppressed.

item.title: Tag Combination
item.description: [#575] I love Eileen / and want you to love her / When you're around / I'm one floor above her / If you could see / just how much I adore her / Oh, that pretty red dress / I'd do anything for her / (Too ra loo ra too ra loo rye ayy)

item.title: Packages
item.description: [#576] Day six: 'The hell? Who mails a bobcat?'

item.title: The Race: Part 1
item.description: [#577] Great, and you JUST finished paying off the settlement over the Wayne Coyne hamster ball incident.

item.title: The Race: Part 2
item.description: [#578] The Hammer + Captain Tightpants == Captain Hammerpants?

item.title: The Race: Part 3
item.description: [#579] No, the best things about The Sarah Connor Chronicles were: (1) watching Sarah and Cameron try to pass for normal, and (2) Cameron throwing people and things through walls. Everything else was pretty secondary.

item.title: The Race: Part 4
item.description: [#580] Things are rarely just crazy enough to work, but they're frequently just crazy enough to fail hilariously.

item.title: The Race: Part 5
item.description: [#581] It was actually canceled because they just noticed he's been naked under that coat the whole time. There's a petition on Facebook to get Fox to un-cancel it, and one on Livejournal to get him to take off the coat.

item.title: Brakes
item.description: [#582] It was the funniest 6.5 seconds of my life, although as usual like 80% of it was just Tom and Ray's gasping, hacking laughter.

item.title: CNR
item.description: [#583] Can't and shouldn't.

item.title: Unsatisfied
item.description: [#584] Forever comparing, never evaluating on any external scale. If you were a sort function, you'd never break the nlogn barrier.

item.title: Outreach
item.description: [#585] Completely implausible? Yes. Nevertheless, worth keeping a can of shark repellent next to the bed.

item.title: Mission to Culture
item.description: [#586] It can't be very MUCH money ... they apparently can't even afford a sampler. I mean, with a little remixing, some of this could be kinda good!

item.title: Crime Scene
item.description: [#587] I think I see a Mandelbrot set! No, that's just blood splatters. Golly.

item.title: Pep Rally
item.description: [#588] You know, pep rallies weirded me out in high school, and they've only gotten creepier in retrospect.

item.title: Designated Drivers
item.description: [#589] Calling a cab means cutting into beer money.

item.title: Papyrus
item.description: [#590] I secretly, deep in my guilty heart, like Papyrus and don't care if it's overused. [Cue hate mail in beautifully-kerned Helvetica.]

item.title: Troll Slayer
item.description: [#591] We have met the enemy and he is us.

item.title: Drama
item.description: [#592] This happens in geek circles every so often. The 'Hey, this is just a system I can figure out easily!' is also a problem among engineers first diving into the stock market.

item.title: Voynich Manuscript
item.description: [#593] Wait, is that the ORIGINAL voynich manuscript? Where did you GET that? Wanna try playing a round of Druids and Dicotyledons?

item.title: Period
item.description: [#594] 413 nanohertz, by the way.

item.title: Android Girlfriend
item.description: [#595] Programming the sexbots to enjoy sex seemed a sensible move at the time, but we didn't realize the consequences of their developing fetishes.

item.title: Latitude
item.description: [#596] The G1, especially with the new Android upgrade, is way better than I originally thought.

item.title: Addiction
item.description: [#597] But if you unplug everything, it gets so quiet you hear that high-pitched empty-room hum. And then the whispers begin.

item.title: Porn
item.description: [#598] I have a thing for corrupt women.

item.title: Apocalypse
item.description: [#599] I wonder if I still have time to go shoot a short film with Kevin Bacon.

item.title: Android Boyfriend
item.description: [#600] Which is, coincidentally, the most unsettling mantlepiece decoration in my house.

item.title: Game Theory
item.description: [#601] Wait, no, that one also loses. How about a nice game of chess?

item.title: Overstimulated
item.description: [#602] My favorite thing to do at parties is to talk judgmentally about people who aren't there.

item.title: Idiocracy
item.description: [#603] People aren't going to change, for better or for worse. Technology's going to be so cool. All in all, the future will be okay! Except climate; we fucked that one up.

item.title: Qwertial Aphasia
item.description: [#604] If this were SMBC, the alt-text drawing thingy would be a giraffe hooker fluttering her eyelashes.

item.title: Extrapolating
item.description: [#605] By the third trimester, there will be hundreds of babies inside you.

item.title: Cutting Edge
item.description: [#606] I remember trying to log in to the original Command and Conquer servers a year or two back and feeling like I was knocking on the boarded-up gates of a ghost town.
[#607] If only we'd chosen 1944-12-02 08:45:52 as the Unix epoch, we could've combined two doomsday scenarios into one and added a really boring scene to that Roland Emmerich movie.

item.title: Form
item.description: [#608] 'This space intentionally left blank' is less immediately provocative but more Hofstadterially confusing.

item.title: Tab Explosion
item.description: [#609] Cracked.com is another inexplicable browser narcotic. They could write a list of '17 worst haircuts in the Ottoman Empire' and I'd read through to the end, then click on all the links at the end.

item.title: Sheeple
item.description: [#610] Hey, what are the odds -- five Ayn Rand fans on the same train! Must be going to a convention.

item.title: Disaster Voyeurism
item.description: [#611] Hurricane forums are full of excited comments about central pressure and wind speed and comparisons to Camille and 1931 and 1938, with hastily-tacked-on notes about how it will be tragic if anyone dies and they hope it's a dud.

item.title: Estimation
item.description: [#612] They could say "the connection is probably lost," but it's more fun to do naive time-averaging to give you hope that if you wait around for 1,163 hours, it will finally finish.

item.title: Threesome
item.description: [#613] I wanted us to try finding an approximate numeric solution, but noooo.

item.title: Woodpecker
item.description: [#614] If you don't have an extension cord I can get that too. Because we're friends! Right?

item.title: Avoidance
item.description: [#615] Hobby: seeing how many menu selections you can get someone to go through before they realize you're not an automated system and/or hang up.

item.title: Lease
item.description: [#616] You should talk to the girl down the hall; I think you'd like her. Lemme know if you find out why she's ordering all those colored plastic balls.

item.title: Understocked
item.description: [#617] My biology grad student friends tell me that different types of alcohol don't actually have different effects. I trust their expertise, not because of the 'biology' part, but because of the 'grad student'.

item.title: Asteroid
item.description: [#618] My Deep Impact/Little Prince crossover fanfic has been poorly received by the community.

item.title: Supported Features
item.description: [#619] I hear many of you finally have smooth Flash support, but me and my Intel card are still waiting on a kernel patch somewhere in the pipeline before we can watch Jon Stewart smoothly.

item.title: Wings
item.description: [#620] Please do not try any of this and die or get arrested.

item.title: Superlative
item.description: [#621] Stay while I recount the crazy TF2 kill I managed yesterday, my friends.

item.title: Haiku Proof
item.description: [#622] After somewhere around 40 hours, there's no academic reason to go to the class. Only go for the hallucinations.

item.title: Oregon
item.description: [#623] A century later, the harrowing flight of the survivors from Oregon was dramatized in a popular video game.

item.title: Branding
item.description: [#624] Actually, 'RSS&M' is kinda catchy.

item.title: Collections
item.description: [#625] You know what really helps an existential crisis? Wondering how much shelf space to leave for a Terry Pratchett collection.

item.title: Newton and Leibniz
item.description: [#626] YEEEEEEAAAAAAHHHHHH!

item.title: Tech Support Cheat Sheet
item.description: [#627] 'Hey Megan, it's your father. How do I print out a flowchart?'

item.title: Psychic
item.description: [#628] You can do a lot better than 1% if you start keeping track of the patterns in what numbers people pick.

item.title: Skins
item.description: [#629] There's Livejournal drama between those who want to wear human suits over fursuits and those who just take off the fursuits.

item.title: Time Travel
item.description:
[#630] She also starts every letter with "Dear Future ".

"." style="height: auto" />

item.title: Anatomy Text
item.description: [#631] For many of the anatomy pictures on Wikipedia, I think this is actually not far from reality. They only look all formal and professional due to careful cropping.

item.title: Suspicion
item.description: [#632] Fine, walk away. I'm gonna go cry into a pint of Ben&Jerry's Brownie Batter(tm) ice cream [link], then take out my frustration on a variety of great flash games from PopCap Games(r) [link].

item.title: Blockbuster Mining
item.description: [#633] The 2007 Bridge to Terebithia trailer put me off too much to see that particular movie, but I am cautiously optimistic about Where the Wild Things Are.

item.title: Date
item.description: [#634] Well, the kid's definitely getting the biology geek phenotype.

item.title: Locke and Demosthenes
